abstract: Moody’s Investors Service, dissatisfied with the way states measure what they owe their retirees, released its own numbers on Thursday, showing that the 50 states have, in aggregate, just 48 cents for every dollar of pensions they have promised, compared with the 74 cents on the dollar that the states now report.
